data.text: A horizontal raised beam with a width of 10 centimeters (4 inches) and a length of 5 meters (16 feet) that is used in gymnastic competition for balancing exercises.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A competitive gymnastics event in which various balancing feats are performed on this beam.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A narrow wooden rail used in gymnastics.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: The horizontal member of any balance (scale,) usually carrying pans at each end, supported at its center by a <xref>fulcrum</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: a gymnastic apparatus used by women gymnasts
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
